Name: Currents
Description: Latest news published in various news sources, blogs and forums
Introduction: The Currents API is a powerful tool for developers and data analysts that provides access to a vast array of news sources, blogs, and forums from around the world. It allows users to search the latest news articles by category, keyword, or region and provides clean, well-structured data, making it easier to parse and integrate into third-party applications. Some of the key functions of this API include: 1) retrieving current news articles by keyword or category, 2) filtering articles by language or region, 3) searching for news by specific sources, and 4) accessing relevant metadata such as author, date published, and article URL. With Currents, developers can deliver real-time, relevant news and updates to their users, enhancing the overall user experience.
Functions:
1. Name: searchNewsArticles
Description: Retrieve current news articles by keyword or category.
Input: {"keywords": "Optional. String. Keywords to search for in the news articles.", "category": "Optional. String. Category of news articles to retrieve.", "language": "Optional. String. Language of the news articles.", "region": "Optional. String. Region of the news articles.", "page": "Optional. Integer. Page number for pagination."}
Output: A list of news articles matching the search criteria, including article title, author, date published, article URL, and source.

2. Name: filterArticlesByLanguageOrRegion
Description: Filter news articles by language or region.
Input: {"language": "Optional. String. Language of the news articles.", "region": "Optional. String. Region of the news articles.", "page": "Optional. Integer. Page number for pagination."}
Output: A list of news articles filtered by the specified language or region, including article title, author, date published, article URL, and source.

3. Name: searchNewsBySource
Description: Search for news articles by specific sources.
Input: {"source": "Required. String. The specific source to search for news articles.", "page": "Optional. Integer. Page number for pagination."}
Output: A list of news articles from the specified source, including article title, author, date published, article URL, and source.

4. Name: getArticleMetadata
Description: Access relevant metadata of a news article.
Input: {"articleId": "Required. String. The unique identifier of the news article."}
Output: Metadata of the specified news article, including article title, author, date published, article URL, and source.

Name: Postman Echo
Description: Test api server to receive and return value from HTTP method
Introduction: Postman Echo is a testing API server that lets developers make HTTP requests and receive response data. This API is useful for testing client applications and making sure they handle different types of response data correctly. Postman Echo provides various endpoints that can handle HTTP methods like GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, etc. Through this API, developers can simulate what it would be like to send and receive responses from an HTTP server without actually having to build and maintain one. Some of the key features provided by Postman Echo include 1) Easily accessible endpoints for HTTP requests and responses. 2) Customizable response data that can be adjusted to mimic different server behavior. 3) Detailed documentation and examples to help developers get started.
Functions:
1. Name: getEcho
Description: Sends a GET request to the specified endpoint and receives response data.
Input: {"endpoint": "Required. String. The endpoint to send the GET request to.", "queryParams": "Optional. Object. Key-value pairs of query parameters to include in the request."}
Output: Returns the response data received from the specified endpoint, including headers, status code, and body.

2. Name: postEcho
Description: Sends a POST request to the specified endpoint with the provided data and receives response data.
Input: {"endpoint": "Required. String. The endpoint to send the POST request to.", "data": "Required. Object. The data to be sent in the request body.", "headers": "Optional. Object. Key-value pairs of headers to include in the request."}
Output: Returns the response data received from the specified endpoint, including headers, status code, and body.

3. Name: putEcho
Description: Sends a PUT request to the specified endpoint with the provided data and receives response data.
Input: {"endpoint": "Required. String. The endpoint to send the PUT request to.", "data": "Required. Object. The data to be sent in the request body.", "headers": "Optional. Object. Key-value pairs of headers to include in the request."}
Output: Returns the response data received from the specified endpoint, including headers, status code, and body.

4. Name: deleteEcho
Description: Sends a DELETE request to the specified endpoint and receives response data.
Input: {"endpoint": "Required. String. The endpoint to send the DELETE request to.", "queryParams": "Optional. Object. Key-value pairs of query parameters to include in the request."}
Output: Returns the response data received from the specified endpoint, including headers, status code, and body.

5. Name: patchEcho
Description: Sends a PATCH request to the specified endpoint with the provided data and receives response data.
Input: {"endpoint": "Required. String. The endpoint to send the PATCH request to.", "data": "Required. Object. The data to be sent in the request body.", "headers": "Optional. Object. Key-value pairs of headers to include in the request."}
Output: Returns the response data received from the specified endpoint, including headers, status code, and body.

6. Name: listEndpoints
Description: Retrieves a list of available endpoints for testing with Postman Echo.
Input: None
Output: Returns an array of available endpoints, including their names, descriptions, and supported HTTP methods.

Name: Steam
Description: Internal Steam Web API documentation
Introduction: The Steam API is an Internal Web Application Programming Interface that provides access to data and functionality within the Steam platform. This API is designed to allow external applications to interact with Steam's features and resources. With this powerful tool, developers can access various functions, including user information, game statistics, and achievements. The Steam API provides several functions to assist with the management of user data, such as login functionality, friend lists, and game ownership. Additionally, it offers the ability to query game data for use in competitive analysis and to retrieve information about specific gaming assets, such as mods, maps, and skins. Overall, the Steam API offers an incredible amount of functionality and versatility for developers looking to integrate their applications with the Steam platform.
Functions:
1. Name: getUserProfile
   Description: Retrieve a user's Steam profile information.
   Input: {"steamID": "Required. String. The user's Steam ID."}
   Output: Returns the user's profile information, including their display name, avatar URL, profile URL, and visibility status.

2. Name: getOwnedGames
   Description: Retrieve a list of games owned by a user.
   Input: {"steamID": "Required. String. The user's Steam ID.", "include_appinfo": "Optional. Boolean. Include game name and logo information in the output."}
   Output: Returns a list of games owned by the user, including game IDs, playtime, and optionally game names and logos.

3. Name: getFriendList
   Description: Retrieve a user's Steam friend list.
   Input: {"steamID": "Required. String. The user's Steam ID.", "relationship": "Optional. String. Filter friends by relationship type (e.g., 'friend', 'blocked')." }
   Output: Returns a list of friends, including their Steam IDs, relationship status, and the date they became friends.

4. Name: getGameStats
   Description: Retrieve game statistics for a specific user and game.
   Input: {"steamID": "Required. String. The user's Steam ID.", "appID": "Required. Integer. The game's Steam application ID."}
   Output: Returns game statistics, including total playtime, achievements, and other game-specific stats.

5. Name: getGameAchievements
   Description: Retrieve a list of achievements for a specific game.
   Input: {"appID": "Required. Integer. The game's Steam application ID.", "language": "Optional. String. The language for achievement display names and descriptions."}
   Output: Returns a list of achievements, including their IDs, display names, descriptions, and icons.

6. Name: getPlayerAchievements
   Description: Retrieve a user's achievements for a specific game.
   Input: {"steamID": "Required. String. The user's Steam ID.", "appID": "Required. Integer. The game's Steam application ID.", "language": "Optional. String. The language for achievement display names and descriptions."}
   Output: Returns a list of the user's achievements, including their IDs, display names, descriptions, icons, and unlock status.

7. Name: searchGameAssets
   Description: Search for game assets, such as mods, maps, and skins.
   Input: {"appID": "Required. Integer. The game's Steam application ID.", "searchQuery": "Required. String. The search query for the desired assets.", "page": "Optional. Integer. The page number for paginated results."}
   Output: Returns a list of matching game assets, including their IDs, names, descriptions, and URLs.

8. Name: getAssetDetails
   Description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific game asset.
   Input: {"assetID": "Required. Integer. The game asset's ID.", "language": "Optional. String. The language for asset display names and descriptions."}
   Output: Returns detailed information about the game asset, including its ID, name, description, URL, and other relevant details.

Name: Cutt.ly
Description: URL shortener service
Introduction: Cutt.ly is an API (Application Programming Interface) that provides a URL shortening service for developers to use in their applications. This service allows users to convert long URLs into short, more manageable links that are easier to share and remember. The Cutt.ly API provides several functions, including: 1) Shorten Links: Allows users to shorten URLs using custom or automatically generated aliases. 2) Expand Links: Retrieves information on the original URL from a shortened link. 3) Custom Domains: Allows users to use a custom branding domain for their shortened links. 4) Analytics: Provides statistics on clicks, referrers, and locations of a shortened link. With this versatile API, developers can create a seamless user experience and enhance their application's functionality.
Functions:
1. Name: shortenLink
   Description: Shortens a given URL using a custom or automatically generated alias.
   Input: {"apiKey": "Required. String. Your Cutt.ly API key.", "longUrl": "Required. String. The URL to be shortened.", "alias": "Optional. String. A custom alias for the shortened URL."}
   Output: Returns the shortened URL with the custom or automatically generated alias.

2. Name: expandLink
   Description: Retrieves information on the original URL from a shortened link.
   Input: {"apiKey": "Required. String. Your Cutt.ly API key.", "shortUrl": "Required. String. The shortened URL to be expanded."}
   Output: Returns the original long URL, creation date, and expiration date (if applicable) of the shortened link.

3. Name: addCustomDomain
   Description: Allows users to use a custom branding domain for their shortened links.
   Input: {"apiKey": "Required. String. Your Cutt.ly API key.", "domain": "Required. String. The custom domain to be used for shortened links."}
   Output: Returns a confirmation message indicating the successful addition of the custom domain.

4. Name: getLinkAnalytics
   Description: Provides statistics on clicks, referrers, and locations of a shortened link.
   Input: {"apiKey": "Required. String. Your Cutt.ly API key.", "shortUrl": "Required. String. The shortened URL to retrieve analytics for.", "dateRange": "Optional. String. The date range for which to retrieve analytics. Format: 'YYYY-MM-DD,YYYY-MM-DD'."}
   Output: Returns the total number of clicks, a list of referrers with their respective click counts, and a list of locations with their respective click counts for the specified shortened link and date range (if provided).

Name: apilayer mailboxlayer
Description: Email address validation
Introduction: The apilayer mailboxlayer API provides a powerful email address validation solution for businesses and individuals. With this API, you can easily verify the validity and deliverability of any email address. It offers functions such as 1) checking syntax errors, 2) verifying mail exchange records, 3) filtering disposable addresses, 4) detecting catch-all servers, 5) testing mailbox availability, and 6) parsing addresses into components. These functions work together seamlessly to provide a comprehensive email validation experience, helping users to confidently communicate with their email contacts.
Functions:
1. Name: validateEmailAddress
   Description: Validates the given email address by checking syntax errors, verifying mail exchange records, filtering disposable addresses, detecting catch-all servers, testing mailbox availability, and parsing addresses into components.
   Input: {"email": "Required. String. The email address to be validated.", "apiKey": "Required. String. Your mailboxlayer API key."}
   Output: Returns an object containing the validation results, including the following information: valid (boolean), format_valid (boolean), mx_found (boolean), smtp_check (boolean), catch_all (boolean), role (boolean), disposable (boolean), and email components (local, domain, and extension).

2. Name: listDisposableDomains
   Description: Retrieves a list of known disposable email domains, which can be used to filter out disposable addresses.
   Input: {"apiKey": "Required. String. Your mailboxlayer API key."}
   Output: Returns an array of disposable email domains.

3. Name: searchDomain
   Description: Searches for a specific domain in the list of known disposable email domains.
   Input: {"domain": "Required. String. The domain to be searched.", "apiKey": "Required. String. Your mailboxlayer API key."}
   Output: Returns an object containing the search result, including the following information: domain (string), disposable (boolean).

4. Name: listCatchAllServers
   Description: Retrieves a list of known catch-all email servers, which can be used to detect catch-all addresses.
   Input: {"apiKey": "Required. String. Your mailboxlayer API key."}
   Output: Returns an array of catch-all email servers.

5. Name: searchCatchAllServer
   Description: Searches for a specific catch-all server in the list of known catch-all email servers.
   Input: {"server": "Required. String. The catch-all server to be searched.", "apiKey": "Required. String. Your mailboxlayer API key."}
   Output: Returns an object containing the search result, including the following information: server (string), catch_all (boolean).

Name: RSS feed to JSON
Description: Returns RSS feed in JSON format using feed URL
Introduction: The RSS Feed to JSON API allows developers to easily retrieve RSS feeds in JSON format. By simply providing the feed URL, the API converts the data into a convenient JSON format, allowing for easy integration into web or mobile applications. The API provides the following main functions: 1) Retrieving the feed items in JSON format. 2) Filtering by specific tags and fields. 3) Sorting by date or other attributes. With these simple functions, developers can quickly and easily incorporate RSS feeds into their applications without needing to worry about implementing complex parsing algorithms.
Functions:
1. Name: getFeedItems
Description: Retrieve the feed items in JSON format.
Input: {"feedUrl": "Required. String. The URL of the RSS feed to be converted to JSON."}
Output: A JSON object containing an array of feed items, each with the following attributes: title, link, description, pubDate, and guid.

2. Name: getFeedItemsByTag
Description: Retrieve the feed items in JSON format filtered by specific tags.
Input: {"feedUrl": "Required. String. The URL of the RSS feed to be converted to JSON.", "tags": "Required. Array of Strings. The tags to filter the feed items by."}
Output: A JSON object containing an array of feed items filtered by the specified tags, each with the following attributes: title, link, description, pubDate, and guid.

3. Name: getFeedItemsByField
Description: Retrieve the feed items in JSON format filtered by specific fields.

Name: Airtel IP
Description: IP Geolocation API. Collecting data from multiple sources
Introduction: The Airtel IP API (Application Programming Interface) is a powerful geolocation tool that helps identify the country of origin of a specific IP address. It collects data from multiple sources, including regional Internet registries, and provides partners like you with comprehensive, accurate information. The API offers the following functions: 1) Identify the country associated with a particular IP address in real-time, along with relevant data points like organization name and contact information. 2) Leverage additional data points such as AS Number and operating system information to improve your applications. 3) Enjoy seamless integration with any application or service through robust API documentation. With Airtel IP, powering your geolocation applications has never been easier.
Functions:
1. Name: getCountryByIpAddress
   Description: Retrieve the country associated with a specific IP address, along with relevant data points like organization name and contact information.
   Input: {"ipAddress": "Required. String. The IP address for which the country information is to be retrieved."}
   Output: Returns an object containing the country name, country code, organization name, contact information, AS Number, and operating system information.

2. Name: getAsNumberByIpAddress
   Description: Retrieve the AS Number associated with a specific IP address.
   Input: {"ipAddress": "Required. String. The IP address for which the AS Number is to be retrieved."}
   Output: Returns the AS Number associated with the given IP address.

3. Name: getOperatingSystemByIpAddress
   Description: Retrieve the operating system information associated with a specific IP address.
   Input: {"ipAddress": "Required. String. The IP address for which the operating system information is to be retrieved."}
   Output: Returns the operating system information associated with the given IP address.

4. Name: searchIpAddress
   Description: Search for IP addresses based on filters such as country, organization, or AS Number.
   Input: {"country": "Optional. String. Filter IP addresses by country name or country code.", "organization": "Optional. String. Filter IP addresses by organization name.", "asNumber": "Optional. Integer. Filter IP addresses by AS Number."}
   Output: Returns a list of IP addresses that match the provided filters, along with their associated country, organization, AS Number, and operating system information.

Name: Fun Fact
Description: A simple HTTPS api that can randomly select and return a fact from the FFA database
Introduction: The Fun Fact API is a lightweight HTTPS resource designed specifically to provide users with random and interesting facts from a constantly updated database. With just a simple call, users can access a wealth of fascinating information ranging from historical events to scientific discoveries. The API features a single function that generates a random fact from the database and returns it to the user. This streamlined design ensures that users receive only relevant data without any unnecessary overhead. The Fun Fact API is perfect for anyone looking to add some excitement to their web or mobile application.
Functions:
1. Name: getRandomFact
Description: Returns a random fact from the database.
Input: None
Output: 
{
    "fact": "String. The random fact retrieved from the database."
}

Name: Graphs for Coronavirus
Description: Each Country separately and Worldwide Graphs for Coronavirus. Daily updates
Introduction: The Graphs for Coronavirus API provides up-to-date information on COVID-19 outbreak statistics around the world. This API is an excellent resource for public health professionals, researchers, and developers who require accurate and detailed data on COVID-19. It offers several functions, including: 1) Retrieving graphs and statistics globally or by specified countries and locations. 2) Daily updates to keep track of the evolution of the virus spread. Additionally, this API is user-friendly and provides structured responses, so users can easily integrate it into their own applications and systems.
Functions:
1. Name: getGlobalStats
Description: Retrieves the latest global statistics on COVID-19.
Input: None
Output: Returns a JSON object containing the following information:
- confirmed: Total number of confirmed cases globally.
- deaths: Total number of deaths globally.
- recovered: Total number of recovered cases globally.
- active: Total number of active cases globally.

2. Name: getCountryStats
Description: Retrieves the latest statistics on COVID-19 for a specified country.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following parameters:
- country: Name of the country to retrieve statistics for.
Output: Returns a JSON object containing the following information:
- confirmed: Total number of confirmed cases for the specified country.
- deaths: Total number of deaths for the specified country.
- recovered: Total number of recovered cases for the specified country.
- active: Total number of active cases for the specified country.

3. Name: getCountryTimeline
Description: Retrieves the timeline of COVID-19 cases for a specified country.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following parameters:
- country: Name of the country to retrieve timeline for.
Output: Returns a JSON object containing the following information:
- dates: Array of dates in YYYY-MM-DD format.
- confirmed: Array of total confirmed cases for each date.
- deaths: Array of total deaths for each date.
- recovered: Array of total recovered cases for each date.
- active: Array of total active cases for each date.

4. Name: getProvinceStats
Description: Retrieves the latest statistics on COVID-19 for a specified province/state within a country.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following parameters:
- country: Name of the country the province/state is located in.
- province: Name of the province/state to retrieve statistics for.
Output: Returns a JSON object containing the following information:
- confirmed: Total number of confirmed cases for the specified province/state.
- deaths: Total number of deaths for the specified province/state.
- recovered: Total number of recovered cases for the specified province/state.
- active: Total number of active cases for the specified province/state.

5. Name: getProvinceTimeline
Description: Retrieves the timeline of COVID-19 cases for a specified province/state within a country.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following parameters:
- country: Name of the country the province/state is located in.
- province: Name of the province/state to retrieve timeline for.
Output: Returns a JSON object containing the following information:
- dates: Array of dates in YYYY-MM-DD format.
- confirmed: Array of total confirmed cases for each date.
- deaths: Array of total deaths for each date.
- recovered: Array of total recovered cases for each date.
- active: Array of total active cases for each date.

On October 2, 2021, there were 43,332,232 confirmed cases, 699,521 deaths, 33,383,375 recoveries, and 9,258,336 active cases. On October 3, 2021, there were 43,422,759 confirmed cases, 699,971 deaths, 33,442,834 recoveries, and 9,313,954 active cases.
Instances.Final Thought: The response from the getCountryTimeline tool shows the timeline of COVID-19 cases for the United States, including the number of confirmed cases, deaths, recoveries, and active cases for each date.

Name: STAPI
Description: Information on all things Star Trek
Introduction: The STAPI (Star Trek API) is a comprehensive resource for all things Star Trek. This API provides developers with access to information on Star Trek episodes, characters, actors, and more. With a simple and intuitive interface, STAPI offers the following functions: 1) Access details about all episodes of all Star Trek series including their titles, air dates, and overviews. 2) Retrieve information on Star Trek characters such as their names, species, and affiliations. 3) Gain access to information about actors and their portrayals of Star Trek characters, including photos, birth dates, and other biographical details. With STAPI, developers can easily integrate Star Trek data into their own apps, websites, or projects.
Functions:
1. Name: getEpisodeDetails
    Description: Retrieve details about a specific Star Trek episode.
    Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
        - episodeId: String. The unique ID of the episode.
    Output: JSON object with the following keys:
        - title: String. The title of the episode.
        - airDate: String. The air date of the episode.
        - overview: String. A brief overview of the episode.
        - series: String. The name of the series the episode belongs to.
        - season: Integer. The season number of the episode.
        - episodeNumber: Integer. The episode number within the season.

2. Name: getCharacterDetails
    Description: Retrieve details about a specific Star Trek character.
    Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
        - characterId: String. The unique ID of the character.
    Output: JSON object with the following keys:
        - name: String. The name of the character.
        - species: String. The species of the character.
        - gender: String. The gender of the character.
        - affiliations: Array of strings. The affiliations of the character.
        - description: String. A brief description of the character.

3. Name: getActorDetails
    Description: Retrieve details about a specific Star Trek actor.
    Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
        - actorId: String. The unique ID of the actor.
    Output: JSON object with the following keys:
        - name: String. The name of the actor.
        - birthDate: String. The birth date of the actor.
        - birthPlace: String. The birth place of the actor.
        - biography: String. A brief biography of the actor.
        - characterIds: Array of strings. The IDs of the Star Trek characters portrayed by the actor.
        - photos: Array of strings. URLs to photos of the actor.

4. Name: searchEpisodes
    Description: Search for Star Trek episodes based on specific criteria.
    Input: Optional. JSON object with the following keys:
        - series: String. The name of the series to search within.
        - season: Integer. The season number to search within.
        - episodeNumber: Integer. The episode number to search for.
        - title: String. The title to search for.
    Output: Array of JSON objects, each with the following keys:
        - title: String. The title of the episode.
        - airDate: String. The air date of the episode.
        - overview: String. A brief overview of the episode.
        - series: String. The name of the series the episode belongs to.
        - season: Integer. The season number of the episode.
        - episodeNumber: Integer. The episode number within the season.

5. Name: searchCharacters
    Description: Search for Star Trek characters based on specific criteria.
    Input: Optional. JSON object with the following keys:
        - name: String. The name to search for.
        - species: String. The species to search for.
        - gender: String. The gender to search for.
        - affiliations: Array of strings. The affiliations to search for.
    Output: Array of JSON objects, each with the following keys:
        - name: String. The name of the character.
        - species: String. The species of the character.
        - gender: String. The gender of the character.
        - affiliations: Array of strings. The affiliations of the character.
        - description: String. A brief description of the character.

6. Name: listSeries
    Description: Retrieve a list of all Star Trek series.
    Input: None.
    Output: Array of strings, each representing the name of a Star Trek series.

7. Name: listCharacters
    Description: Retrieve a list of all Star Trek characters.
    Input: None.
    Output: Array of JSON objects, each with the following keys:
        - name: String. The name of the character.
        - characterId: String. The unique ID of the character.

8. Name: listActors
    Description: Retrieve a list of all Star Trek actors.
    Input: None.
    Output: Array of JSON objects, each with the following keys:
        - name: String. The name of the actor.
        - actorId: String. The unique ID of the actor.

Name: Feedbin
Description: RSS reader
Introduction: The Feedbin API is a powerful tool that allows developers to integrate Feedbin's RSS reader functionality into their own applications. This API provides the following functions: 1) Get all of a user's feeds. 2) Get all of a user's unread entries. 3) Retrieve entries from a specified feed by timestamp. 4) Star, mark as read, or un-mark as read an entry. 5) Retrieve metadata about a feed, including its title, URL, and icon. With these functions, developers can create innovative, user-friendly applications that streamline the RSS reading experience.
Functions:
1. Name: getUserFeeds
Description: Retrieves all of a user's feeds.
Input: None
Output: Returns an array of JSON objects, each representing a feed. Each object contains the following fields:
- id: Integer. The unique ID of the feed.
- title: String. The title of the feed.
- feed_url: String. The URL of the feed.
- site_url: String. The URL of the feed's website.
- is_spark: Boolean. Indicates whether the feed is a Spark feed.
- last_updated_at: String. The timestamp of the feed's last update.

2. Name: getUserUnreadEntries
Description: Retrieves all of a user's unread entries.
Input: None
Output: Returns an array of JSON objects, each representing an unread entry. Each object contains the following fields:
- id: Integer. The unique ID of the entry.
- title: String. The title of the entry.
- author: String. The author of the entry.
- content: String. The content of the entry.
- url: String. The URL of the entry.
- feed_id: Integer. The ID of the feed that the entry belongs to.
- published: String. The timestamp of the entry's publication.
- created_at: String. The timestamp of the entry's creation.
- updated_at: String. The timestamp of the entry's last update.

3. Name: getFeedEntriesByTimestamp
Description: Retrieves entries from a specified feed by timestamp.
Input: 
- feed_id: Required. Integer. The ID of the feed to retrieve entries from.
- timestamp: Required. String. The timestamp to retrieve entries from, in the format "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ".
Output: Returns an array of JSON objects, each representing an entry. Each object contains the following fields:
- id: Integer. The unique ID of the entry.
- title: String. The title of the entry.
- author: String. The author of the entry.
- content: String. The content of the entry.
- url: String. The URL of the entry.
- feed_id: Integer. The ID of the feed that the entry belongs to.
- published: String. The timestamp of the entry's publication.
- created_at: String. The timestamp of the entry's creation.
- updated_at: String. The timestamp of the entry's last update.

4. Name: markEntry
Description: Stars, marks as read, or un-marks as read an entry.
Input: 
- entry_id: Required. Integer. The ID of the entry to mark.
- star: Optional. Boolean. Indicates whether to star the entry.
- read: Optional. Boolean. Indicates whether to mark the entry as read.
Output: Returns a JSON object representing the updated entry. The object contains the same fields as the entry object returned by the getFeedEntriesByTimestamp function.

5. Name: getFeedMetadata
Description: Retrieves metadata about a feed, including its title, URL, and icon.
Input: 
- feed_id: Required. Integer. The ID of the feed to retrieve metadata for.
Output: Returns a JSON object representing the feed's metadata. The object contains the following fields:
- title: String. The title of the feed.
- feed_url: String. The URL of the feed.
- site_url: String. The URL of the feed's website.
- icon_url: String. The URL of the feed's icon.

Name: RuneScape
Description: RuneScape and OSRS RPGs information
Introduction: The RuneScape API (Application Programming Interface) is a set of tools designed to provide information about RuneScape and OSRS RPGs. It provides developers with information about skills, items, quests, combat, and more. The API offers the following functions: 1) Retrieve high scores for players. 2) Retrieve information on specific items, enemies, skills, and quests. 3) Perform in-game actions such as buying or selling items, casting spells, and more. The RuneScape API provides a wealth of information, allowing developers to integrate RuneScape data into their applications.
Functions:
1. Name: getHighScores
Description: Retrieve high scores for a player.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
- player: String. The name of the player to retrieve high scores for.
- mode: String. The game mode to retrieve high scores for. Options are "normal", "ironman", "hardcore_ironman", and "ultimate_ironman".
Output: An array of objects, each representing a skill or activity. Each object has the following keys:
- rank: Integer. The player's rank in this skill or activity.
- level: Integer. The player's level in this skill or activity.
- experience: Integer. The player's experience in this skill or activity.

2. Name: getItemInfo
Description: Retrieve information on a specific item.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
- item: String. The name of the item to retrieve information for.
Output: An object with the following keys:
- name: String. The name of the item.
- id: Integer. The unique ID of the item.
- examine: String. The examine text for the item.
- members: Boolean. Whether the item is members-only or not.
- tradeable: Boolean. Whether the item is tradeable or not.
- highalch: Integer. The high alchemy value of the item.
- lowalch: Integer. The low alchemy value of the item.
- value: Integer. The value of the item in coins.
- weight: Float. The weight of the item.

3. Name: getEnemyInfo
Description: Retrieve information on a specific enemy.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
- enemy: String. The name of the enemy to retrieve information for.
Output: An object with the following keys:
- name: String. The name of the enemy.
- id: Integer. The unique ID of the enemy.
- examine: String. The examine text for the enemy.
- combatlevel: Integer. The combat level of the enemy.
- hitpoints: Integer. The hitpoints of the enemy.
- maxhit: Integer. The maximum hit of the enemy.
- attack: Integer. The attack level of the enemy.
- strength: Integer. The strength level of the enemy.
- defence: Integer. The defence level of the enemy.
- magic: Integer. The magic level of the enemy.
- ranged: Integer. The ranged level of the enemy.

4. Name: getSkillInfo
Description: Retrieve information on a specific skill.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
- skill: String. The name of the skill to retrieve information for.
Output: An object with the following keys:
- name: String. The name of the skill.
- id: Integer. The unique ID of the skill.
- members: Boolean. Whether the skill is members-only or not.
- rank: Integer. The player's rank in this skill.
- level: Integer. The player's level in this skill.
- experience: Integer. The player's experience in this skill.

5. Name: getQuestInfo
Description: Retrieve information on a specific quest.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
- quest: String. The name of the quest to retrieve information for.
Output: An object with the following keys:
- name: String. The name of the quest.
- id: Integer. The unique ID of the quest.
- members: Boolean. Whether the quest is members-only or not.
- difficulty: String. The difficulty level of the quest.
- length: String. The length of the quest.
- questpoints: Integer. The number of quest points awarded for completing the quest.
- series: String. The quest series that the quest belongs to.

6. Name: performAction
Description: Perform an in-game action.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
- action: String. The name of the action to perform. Options are "buy", "sell", "cast_spell", and "use_item".
- item: String. The name of the item to buy, sell, or use.
- spell: String. The name of the spell to cast.
- quantity: Integer. The quantity of the item to buy, sell, or use.
Output: An object with the following keys:
- success: Boolean. Whether the action was successful or not.
- message: String. A message describing the result of the action.

Name: WakaTime
Description: Automated time tracking leaderboards for programmers
Introduction: WakaTime offers an advanced and intuitive time-tracking API designed specifically for developers. This API offers several functions, including: 1) Collect time metrics on programming languages, editors, and projects being worked on. 2) Retrieve and analyze detailed data reports to help developers understand their work habits and productivity. 3) Integrate leaderboard features to track progress, and encourage healthy competition amongst developers. With the WakaTime API, software developers can optimize their workflows and gain insights into their productivity that will ultimately help them improve efficiency and reach their goals faster.
Functions:
1. Name: Get User
Description: Retrieve user information, including name, email, and timezone.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following fields:
- api_key: String. The user's API key.
Output: JSON object with the following fields:
- username: String. The user's username.
- email: String. The user's email address.
- timezone: String. The user's timezone.

2. Name: Get Stats
Description: Retrieve time metrics on programming languages, editors, and projects being worked on.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following fields:
- api_key: String. The user's API key.
- start: String. The start date for the time range to retrieve stats for, in the format "YYYY-MM-DD".
- end: String. The end date for the time range to retrieve stats for, in the format "YYYY-MM-DD".
Output: JSON object with the following fields:
- data: Array. An array of objects containing the following fields:
  - name: String. The name of the programming language, editor, or project.
  - total_seconds: Integer. The total number of seconds spent on the language, editor, or project during the specified time range.
  - digital: Boolean. Indicates whether the time was spent on a digital or non-digital project.

3. Name: Get Summary
Description: Retrieve a summary of time metrics for a specific day.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following fields:
- api_key: String. The user's API key.
- date: String. The date to retrieve the summary for, in the format "YYYY-MM-DD".
Output: JSON object with the following fields:
- data: Object. An object containing the following fields:
  - categories: Array. An array of objects containing the following fields:
    - name: String. The name of the category.
    - total_seconds: Integer. The total number of seconds spent on the category during the specified day.
  - dependencies: Array. An array of objects containing the following fields:
    - name: String. The name of the dependency.
    - total_seconds: Integer. The total number of seconds spent on the dependency during the specified day.
  - editors: Array. An array of objects containing the following fields:
    - name: String. The name of the editor.
    - total_seconds: Integer. The total number of seconds spent on the editor during the specified day.
  - languages: Array. An array of objects containing the following fields:
    - name: String. The name of the programming language.
    - total_seconds: Integer. The total number of seconds spent on the language during the specified day.
  - operating_systems: Array. An array of objects containing the following fields:
    - name: String. The name of the operating system.
    - total_seconds: Integer. The total number of seconds spent on the operating system during the specified day.
  - projects: Array. An array of objects containing the following fields:
    - name: String. The name of the project.
    - total_seconds: Integer. The total number of seconds spent on the project during the specified day.
  - range: Object. An object containing the following fields:
    - start: String. The start time of the day, in ISO 8601 format.
    - end: String. The end time of the day, in ISO 8601 format.
  - timezone: String. The user's timezone.

4. Name: Get Leaderboard
Description: Retrieve a leaderboard of the top users based on time spent on a specific project.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following fields:
- api_key: String. The user's API key.
- project: String. The name of the project to retrieve the leaderboard for.
Output: JSON object with the following fields:
- data: Array. An array of objects containing the following fields:
  - user: Object. An object containing the following fields:
    - username: String. The username of the user.
    - full_name: String. The full name of the user.
  - total_seconds: Integer. The total number of seconds the user spent on the project.
  - rank: Integer. The user's rank on the leaderboard.

5. Name: Get Heartbeats
Description: Retrieve a list of heartbeats for a specific day.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following fields:
- api_key: String. The user's API key.
- date: String. The date to retrieve the heartbeats for, in the format "YYYY-MM-DD".
Output: JSON object with the following fields:
- data: Array. An array of objects containing the following fields:
  - time: String. The time the heartbeat was recorded, in ISO 8601 format.
  - entity: String. The name of the entity the heartbeat was recorded for (e.g. project, file, branch).
  - type: String. The type of entity the heartbeat was recorded for (e.g. project, file, branch).
  - is_write: Boolean. Indicates whether the heartbeat was recorded for a write event.
  - language: String. The programming language associated with the heartbeat.
  - editor: String. The editor associated with the heartbeat.
  - project: String. The project associated with the heartbeat.

Name: Transport for Spain
Description: Public trains of Spain
Introduction: Transport for Spain is an API that enables users to access real-time train information for public trains in Spain. With this API, users can retrieve train schedules, track train locations, and check train status. The API is simple to use and provides real-time updates for accurate train information. Some of the features provided by Transport for Spain are: 1) Retrieve train schedules for a specific station or route. 2) Track the current location of trains in real-time. 3) Get the latest information on train delays, cancellations, and other disruptions. With these features, Transport for Spain allows users to plan their train travel with ease and stay informed about any changes to their journey.
Functions:
1. Name: getTrainSchedule
Description: Retrieve train schedules for a specific station or route.
Input: {"station": "Required. String. The name of the station to retrieve schedules for.", "route": "Optional. String. The name of the route to retrieve schedules for."}
Output: Returns a list of train schedules for the specified station or route. Each schedule includes the train number, departure time, and arrival time.

2. Name: trackTrainLocation
Description: Track the current location of trains in real-time.
Input: {"train_number": "Required. Integer. The number of the train to track."}
Output: Returns the current location of the specified train, including the train's latitude and longitude coordinates, as well as its speed and direction.

3. Name: getTrainStatus
Description: Get the latest information on train delays, cancellations, and other disruptions.
Input: {"train_number": "Required. Integer. The number of the train to check status for."}
Output: Returns the current status of the specified train, including any delays, cancellations, or other disruptions. If the train is running on time, the output will indicate that as well.

Name: Magic The Gathering
Description: Magic The Gathering Game Information
Introduction: The Magic The Gathering API is a resource for accessing detailed information about the popular collectible card game. It offers several useful functions, including: 1) Retrieving cards, including their details and images, based on various criteria such as name, set, and color. 2) Searching for sets and retrieving set information, including set details and images. 3) Retrieving information about individual artists who have contributed to the game.  Overall, this API allows developers to leverage rich Magic The Gathering data to enhance their applications and create engaging user experiences.
Functions:
1. Name: getCard
Description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific Magic The Gathering card.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
- name: String. The name of the card to retrieve.
Output: JSON object with the following keys:
- name: String. The name of the card.
- manaCost: String. The mana cost of the card.
- cmc: Integer. The converted mana cost of the card.
- colors: Array of Strings. The colors of the card.
- type: String. The type of the card.
- rarity: String. The rarity of the card.
- set: String. The set the card belongs to.
- text: String. The text on the card.
- imageUrl: String. The URL of the image of the card.

2. Name: searchCards
Description: Searches for Magic The Gathering cards based on various criteria.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
- name: Optional. String. The name of the card to search for.
- set: Optional. String. The set the card belongs to.
- color: Optional. String. The color of the card.
- type: Optional. String. The type of the card.
- rarity: Optional. String. The rarity of the card.
- artist: Optional. String. The name of the artist who illustrated the card.
Output: Array of JSON objects, each representing a card with the following keys:
- name: String. The name of the card.
- manaCost: String. The mana cost of the card.
- cmc: Integer. The converted mana cost of the card.
- colors: Array of Strings. The colors of the card.
- type: String. The type of the card.
- rarity: String. The rarity of the card.
- set: String. The set the card belongs to.
- text: String. The text on the card.
- imageUrl: String. The URL of the image of the card.

3. Name: getSet
Description: Retrieves information about a specific Magic The Gathering set.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
- code: String. The code of the set to retrieve.
Output: JSON object with the following keys:
- name: String. The name of the set.
- code: String. The code of the set.
- releaseDate: String. The release date of the set.
- type: String. The type of the set.
- block: String. The block the set belongs to.
- cards: Array of JSON objects. Each representing a card in the set, with the following keys:
  - name: String. The name of the card.
  - manaCost: String. The mana cost of the card.
  - cmc: Integer. The converted mana cost of the card.
  - colors: Array of Strings. The colors of the card.
  - type: String. The type of the card.
  - rarity: String. The rarity of the card.
  - set: String. The set the card belongs to.
  - text: String. The text on the card.
  - imageUrl: String. The URL of the image of the card.

4. Name: searchSets
Description: Searches for Magic The Gathering sets based on various criteria.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
- name: Optional. String. The name of the set to search for.
- block: Optional. String. The block the set belongs to.
Output: Array of JSON objects, each representing a set with the following keys:
- name: String. The name of the set.
- code: String. The code of the set.
- releaseDate: String. The release date of the set.
- type: String. The type of the set.

5. Name: getArtist
Description: Retrieves information about a specific Magic The Gathering artist.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
- name: String. The name of the artist to retrieve.
Output: JSON object with the following keys:
- name: String. The name of the artist.
- imageUrl: String. The URL of the image of the artist.
- sets: Array of Strings. The sets the artist has contributed to.

How many cards are in the latest expansion set of Magic The Gathering?
Show me the artwork of the latest planeswalker card in Magic The Gathering.

Instances.input: What are the rules for the Commander format in Magic The Gathering?
Instances.output: The Commander format is a Magic The Gathering format in which each player starts with a deck of 100 cards, including a legendary creature as the commander of the deck. Players can only use cards from the Commander, Planechase, Archenemy, Conspiracy, and Vanguard sets, as well as any other sets released after the Commander set. Each player starts with 40 life points and can only use one copy of any card, except for basic lands.
Instances.Final Thought: The getCard tool returned a card called "Akroma's Vengeance" which contains text related to the format. I should use the text field of the card to find the rules of the format.

Name: Transport for Sao Paulo, Brazil
Description: SPTrans
Introduction: The SPTrans API (Application Programming Interface) is designed to help developers access real-time transportation information for the city of Sao Paulo, Brazil. With this API, users can get real-time data about bus and metro services, including estimated arrival times, service alerts, and locations. The following functions are provided: 1) Retrieve the location of all vehicles on a specified route. 2) Get real-time arrival and departure times for all stops on a specified route. 3) Obtain schedules and route information for all buses and metro trains, including stop locations, route maps, and estimated travel times. 4) Access alerts and service notifications for individual routes or the entire transportation network. Developers can use the SPTrans API to build innovative transportation apps, improve their own services, or simply stay informed about public transport in Sao Paulo.
Functions:
1. Name: getVehicleLocations
Description: Retrieve the location of all vehicles on a specified route.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
- routeId: Integer. The ID of the route to retrieve vehicle locations for.
Output: An array of JSON objects, each representing a vehicle on the specified route. Each object contains the following keys:
- vehicleId: Integer. The ID of the vehicle.
- prefix: String. The prefix of the vehicle.
- latitude: Float. The latitude of the vehicle's current location.
- longitude: Float. The longitude of the vehicle's current location.
- time: String. The time the location was last updated.

2. Name: getRealTimeArrivalDeparture
Description: Get real-time arrival and departure times for all stops on a specified route.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
- routeId: Integer. The ID of the route to retrieve arrival and departure times for.
- stopId: Integer. The ID of the stop to retrieve arrival and departure times for.
Output: An array of JSON objects, each representing an arrival or departure time for the specified route and stop. Each object contains the following keys:
- type: String. Indicates whether the time is an arrival or departure time.
- time: String. The time of the arrival or departure.
- vehicleId: Integer. The ID of the vehicle.
- prefix: String. The prefix of the vehicle.

3. Name: getScheduleRouteInfo
Description: Obtain schedules and route information for all buses and metro trains, including stop locations, route maps, and estimated travel times.
Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
- routeId: Integer. The ID of the route to retrieve schedule and route information for.
Output: A JSON object containing the following keys:
- routeName: String. The name of the route.
- routeMap: String. A URL to the route map.
- estimatedTravelTime: Integer. The estimated travel time for the route.
- stops: An array of JSON objects, each representing a stop on the route. Each object contains the following keys:
  - stopId: Integer. The ID of the stop.
  - stopName: String. The name of the stop.
  - latitude: Float. The latitude of the stop's location.
  - longitude: Float. The longitude of the stop's location.

4. Name: getServiceAlerts
Description: Access alerts and service notifications for individual routes or the entire transportation network.
Input: Optional. JSON object with the following keys:
- routeId: Integer. The ID of the route to retrieve alerts for.
- stopId: Integer. The ID of the stop to retrieve alerts for.
Output: An array of JSON objects, each representing a service alert or notification. Each object contains the following keys:
- alertId: Integer. The ID of the alert.
- alertType: String. The type of the alert.
- alertDescription: String. A description of the alert.
- routeId: Integer. The ID of the route the alert is associated with.
- stopId: Integer. The ID of the stop the alert is associated with.

Name: Shrtlnk
Description: Simple and efficient short link creation
Introduction: Shrtlnk API is a reliable and straightforward URL shortening service that generates short links for long URLs. With Shrtlnk, developers can easily create a shortened URL and customize it for their specific needs. The API supports the following functions: 1) Shorten a URL by providing the long URL to the API. 2) Retrieve information about a shortened URL, such as its creation date and the number of times it has been accessed. 3) Generate a QR code for any shortened URL. 4) Manage multiple links with tags and groups. Shrtlnk's API simplifies URL shortening for developers, making it an ideal choice for applications that require efficient link sharing and tracking.

Name: Transport for The Netherlands
Description: NS, only trains
Introduction: The Transport for The Netherlands API (Application Programming Interface) is a reliable and secure way to get real-time train information in The Netherlands. This API is specifically designed for NS trains. The API provides several functions, including: 1) Retrieve real-time train schedules and delays. 2) Check train availability and occupancy levels. 3) Retrieve platform numbers for departing and arriving trains. 4) Retrieve station information, such as amenities, accessibility and timetables. The API returns the data in JSON format for easy integration into third-party applications.
Functions:
1. Name: getRealTimeTrainSchedule
Description: Retrieve real-time train schedules and delays.
Input: 
{
  "station": "Required. String. The station code for the departure station.",
  "destination": "Required. String. The station code for the destination station.",
  "time": "Optional. String. The departure time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm'. If not provided, the current time will be used."
}
Output: Returns a JSON object containing the following information:
- Train number
- Departure time
- Arrival time
- Delay time (if any)
- Train type
- Train route
- Train status

2. Name: checkTrainAvailability
Description: Check train availability and occupancy levels.
Input: 
{
  "trainNumber": "Required. Integer. The train number.",
  "date": "Required. String. The date in the format of 'yyyy-mm-dd'.",
  "class": "Optional. String. The class of the train, either '1' or '2'. If not provided, both classes will be checked."
}
Output: Returns a JSON object containing the following information:
- Train number
- Date
- Class
- Availability status (either 'available' or 'unavailable')
- Occupancy level (if available)

3. Name: getPlatformNumber
Description: Retrieve platform numbers for departing and arriving trains.
Input: 
{
  "station": "Required. String. The station code for the departure or arrival station.",
  "direction": "Required. String. The direction of the train, either 'departures' or 'arrivals'.",
  "time": "Optional. String. The time in the format of 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm'. If not provided, the current time will be used."
}
Output: Returns a JSON object containing the following information:
- Train number
- Platform number
- Departure or arrival time

4. Name: getStationInformation
Description: Retrieve station information, such as amenities, accessibility and timetables.
Input: 
{
  "station": "Required. String. The station code for the station.",
  "lang": "Optional. String. The language of the information, either 'nl' or 'en'. If not provided, the default language will be used."
}
Output: Returns a JSON object containing the following information:
- Station name
- Station code
- Station type
- Station amenities (such as toilets, shops, and restaurants)
- Station accessibility information (such as wheelchair accessibility and assistance for visually impaired passengers)
- Station timetable (including departure and arrival times for all trains at the station)

Name: Arbeitsamt
Description: API for the "Arbeitsamt", which is a german Job board aggregator
Introduction: The Arbeitsamt API is a powerful resource for job seekers and employers in Germany, providing access to a wealth of data from the Arbeitsamt job board aggregator. This API offers the following functions: 1) Search job listings for keywords in specified locations and filter by job category, salary range, and other criteria. 2) Retrieve details of an individual job posting, including the job description, qualifications, and application instructions. 3) Access information on companies and organizations posting job listings, with details on their size, industry, and location. By integrating with the Arbeitsamt API, users can build custom job search and talent acquisition applications with ease.
Functions:
1. Name: searchJobs
    Description: Search for job listings based on specified criteria.
    Input: Required. JSON object with the following keys:
        - keywords: String. The search keywords.
        - location: String. The location to search in.
        - category: String. The job category to filter by.
        - salaryRange: String. The salary range to filter by.
        - page: Integer. The page number of the search results to retrieve.
        - pageSize: Integer. The number of search results to retrieve per page.
    Output: An array of job listing objects, each containing the following keys:
        - id: String. The unique identifier of the job listing.
        - title: String. The title of the job listing.
        - company: String. The name of the company posting the job listing.
        - location: String. The location of the job listing.
        - salary: String. The salary range of the job listing.
        - description: String. The description of the job listing.
        - qualifications: String. The qualifications required for the job listing.
        - applicationInstructions: String. The instructions for applying to the job listing.
        
2. Name: getJobDetails
    Description: Retrieve details of an individual job posting.
    Input: Required. JSON object with the following key:
        - jobId: String. The unique identifier of the job listing.
    Output: A job listing object with the following keys:
        - id: String. The unique identifier of the job listing.
        - title: String. The title of the job listing.
        - company: String. The name of the company posting the job listing.
        - location: String. The location of the job listing.
        - salary: String. The salary range of the job listing.
        - description: String. The description of the job listing.
        - qualifications: String. The qualifications required for the job listing.
        - applicationInstructions: String. The instructions for applying to the job listing.
        
3. Name: getCompanyDetails
    Description: Retrieve details of a company posting job listings.
    Input: Required. JSON object with the following key:
        - companyId: String. The unique identifier of the company.
    Output: A company object with the following keys:
        - id: String. The unique identifier of the company.
        - name: String. The name of the company.
        - size: String. The size of the company.
        - industry: String. The industry of the company.
        - location: String. The location of the company.
        - jobListings: Array. An array of job listing objects posted by the company, each containing the following keys:
            - id: String. The unique identifier of the job listing.
            - title: String. The title of the job listing.
            - location: String. The location of the job listing.
            - salary: String. The salary range of the job listing.

Name: CO2 Offset
Description: API calculates and validates the carbon footprint
Introduction: The CO2 Offset API (Application Programming Interface) calculates and validates carbon footprints, making it easier for businesses and individuals to offset their emissions. The API offers the following functions: 1) Calculate carbon emissions of any product or activity across various industries. 2) Retrieve a list of carbon offset projects available to offset emissions. 3) Purchase carbon offsets based on calculations from other functions. The API's purpose is to provide a user-friendly and accessible platform for individuals and businesses to reduce their carbon footprint and make a positive impact on the environment.

Instructions: Hey, can you help me determine the carbon emissions of driving 500 miles in my gasoline-powered car? I'm in the automotive industry and want to calculate my impact on the environment. Once you figure that out, let me know the projects available to offset my emissions.

For my wedding, my fiancé and I recently ordered 2000 flowers that were grown in a greenhouse. We're trying to have a sustainable event, so could you calculate the carbon emissions resulting from the cultivation of these flowers in the agriculture industry? And, provide a list of offset projects we can choose from to balance our environmental impact.

Instances.input: Hey, can you help me determine the carbon emissions of driving 500 miles in my gasoline-powered car? I'm in the automotive industry and want to calculate my impact on the environment. Once you figure that out, let me know the projects available to offset my emissions.
Instances.output: Driving 500 miles in a gasoline-powered car results in 43.85 metric tons of CO2 emissions. To offset these emissions, you can purchase carbon offsets from two projects: the Drive Green program, which is in the automotive industry and has an offset per unit cost of 0.25, and the Tree plantation program, which is in the agriculture industry and has an offset per unit cost of 0.1.
Instances.Final Thought: The user has requested a list of offset projects available to offset their emissions. The list contains two projects, one in the automotive industry and one in the agriculture industry.
intermediate_steps: Status Code: 200. Response: {"projects":[{"projectId":1234,"name":"Drive Green program","description":"A program that encourages the use of electric cars to reduce carbon emissions.","industry":"Automotive","location":"Global","offsetPerUnitCost":0.25},{"projectId":5678,"name":"Tree plantation program","description":"A program that plants trees to offset carbon emissions.","industry":"Agriculture","location":"USA","offsetPerUnitCost":0.1}]}

Instances.input: For my wedding, my fiancé and I recently ordered 2000 flowers that were grown in a greenhouse. We're trying to have a sustainable event, so could you calculate the carbon emissions resulting from the cultivation of these flowers in the agriculture industry? And, provide a list of offset projects we can choose from to balance our environmental impact.
Instances.output: The cultivation of 2000 flowers in the agriculture industry produces 1.26 metric tons of CO2 equivalent. You can purchase carbon offsets from projects such as Afforestation Project in Brazil, Biodigestion Project in Mexico, and Manure Management Project in the USA to balance the environmental impact of your wedding.
Instances.Final Thought: Based on the emissions and the list of offset projects, the user can purchase carbon offsets to balance the environmental impact of their wedding.
intermediate_steps: Status Code: 200. Response: {"projects":[{"projectId":1001,"name":"Afforestation Project","description":"Carbon offset project that involves planting trees in deforested areas.","industry":"Agriculture","location":"Brazil","offsetPerUnitCost":0.0012},{"projectId":1002,"name":"Biodigestion Project","description":"Carbon offset project that involves generating biogas from animal waste and using it to produce electricity.","industry":"Agriculture","location":"Mexico","offsetPerUnitCost":0.0025},{"projectId":1003,"name":"Manure Management Project","description":"Carbon offset project that involves capturing methane emissions from livestock manure and using it to generate energy.","industry":"Agriculture","location":"USA","offsetPerUnitCost":0.002}]}

Name: Transport for Vancouver, Canada
Description: TransLink
Introduction: The Transport for Vancouver, Canada API, also known as TransLink, is a comprehensive resource for accessing real-time and historical transportation data in the Vancouver area. With this API, developers can access a wide range of transit information, including bus schedules, train arrivals and departures, and live traffic data. The following functions are provided: 1) Retrieve real-time and historical data on buses, trains, ferries, and other transit options. 2) Locate stations or stops near a specific address or GPS coordinate. 3) Retrieve detailed information about a specific station or stop including amenities, accessibility, and estimated wait times. With TransLink, developers can create applications that help commuters plan their trips, optimize travel routes, and reduce travel times.
Functions:
1. Name: getRealTimeTransitData
Description: Retrieve real-time and historical data on buses, trains, ferries, and other transit options.
Input: {"routeNumber": "Required. String. The route number of the transit option.", "dateTime": "Optional. String. The date and time for historical data in YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS format."}
Output: Returns an array of transit data objects containing information such as route number, vehicle type, direction, arrival time, departure time, and location coordinates.

2. Name: findStationsOrStops
Description: Locate stations or stops near a specific address or GPS coordinate.
Input: {"address": "Optional. String. The address to search for nearby stations or stops.", "latitude": "Optional. Float. The latitude coordinate to search for nearby stations or stops.", "longitude": "Optional. Float. The longitude coordinate to search for nearby stations or stops.", "radius": "Optional. Integer. The search radius in meters."}
Output: Returns an array of station or stop objects containing information such as station or stop ID, name, address, latitude, longitude, and distance from the search location.

3. Name: getStationOrStopDetails
Description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific station or stop including amenities, accessibility, and estimated wait times.
Input: {"stationOrStopId": "Required. Integer. The ID of the station or stop to retrieve information for."}
Output: Returns a station or stop object containing information such as station or stop ID, name, address, latitude, longitude, amenities, accessibility features, and estimated wait times for transit options.

4. Name: searchStationsOrStops
Description: Search for stations or stops by name or partial name.
Input: {"query": "Required. String. The name or partial name of the station or stop to search for."}
Output: Returns an array of station or stop objects containing information such as station or stop ID, name, address, latitude, and longitude.

5. Name: getTransitRouteDetails
Description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific transit route, including stops, schedules, and route map.
Input: {"routeNumber": "Required. String. The route number of the transit option."}
Output: Returns a transit route object containing information such as route number, vehicle type, direction, stops, schedules, and route map URL.

Instructions: I'm near the intersection of Main Street and East Hastings Street, and I need to find a nearby SkyTrain station. Can you locate the closest station to my location and provide me with the details about it, including the train routes and schedules?

Instances.input: I'm near the intersection of Main Street and East Hastings Street, and I need to find a nearby SkyTrain station. Can you locate the closest station to my location and provide me with the details about it, including the train routes and schedules?
Instances.output: The closest SkyTrain station to the intersection of Main Street and East Hastings Street is Main St and Hastings St, which is 500 meters away. It has amenities such as bike parkade, west building entrance, washrooms, payphone, and food concessions. It is also accessible with escalators, elevators, tactile walking surface indicators, and an accessible platform. The estimated wait times for buses, trains, and ferries are 3 minutes, no current wait time, and 30 minutes respectively. The SkyTrain route includes stops at Main St Science World Station, Commercial-Broadway Station, and Waterfront Station. The schedule for the route is the same every day of the week, with the first train departing at 5:23AM, the second at 5:36AM, and the third at 5:49AM. The route map can be found at https://maps.
Instances.Final Thought: The SkyTrain route includes stops at Main St Science World Station, Commercial-Broadway Station, and Waterfront Station. The schedule for the route is the same every day of the week, with the first train departing at 5:23AM, the second at 5:36AM, and the third at 5:49AM. The route map can be found at the provided URL.

The estimated wait times at each stop are: Science World-Chinatown (3 minutes), Stadium-Chinatown (7 minutes), and King Edward (10 minutes). The route map URL is https://www.translink.ca/en/Planning-and-Scheduling/Schedules-and-Routes/SkyTrain.aspx.

Name: YNAB
Description: Budgeting & Planning
Introduction: YNAB's API (Application Programming Interface) is a powerful tool for budgeting and financial planning. It allows users to connect their YNAB account to other applications, and provides the following features: 1) Retrieve user budget data such as accounts, categories, payees, transactions and budgets. 2) Create and update transactions and their associated metadata. 3) Access financial institutions through direct import and account synchronization. With its comprehensive functionality, YNAB's API empowers users to take control of their finances and create effective financial plans.
Functions:
1. Name: getUserBudgets
Description: Retrieve a list of user's budgets with their associated information.
Input: {"accessToken": "Required. String. The user's access token for authentication."}
Output: A list of budgets with their ID, name, currency format, date format, and last modified date.

2. Name: getBudgetAccounts
Description: Retrieve a list of accounts for a specific budget.
Input: {"accessToken": "Required. String. The user's access token for authentication.", "budgetId": "Required. String. The ID of the budget to retrieve accounts for."}
Output: A list of accounts with their ID, name, type, balance, and cleared balance.

3. Name: getBudgetCategories
Description: Retrieve a list of categories for a specific budget.
Input: {"accessToken": "Required. String. The user's access token for authentication.", "budgetId": "Required. String. The ID of the budget to retrieve categories for."}
Output: A list of categories with their ID, name, group, and budgeted amount.

4. Name: getBudgetPayees
Description: Retrieve a list of payees for a specific budget.
Input: {"accessToken": "Required. String. The user's access token for authentication.", "budgetId": "Required. String. The ID of the budget to retrieve payees for."}
Output: A list of payees with their ID, name, and associated transactions.

5. Name: getBudgetTransactions
Description: Retrieve a list of transactions for a specific budget.
Input: {"accessToken": "Required. String. The user's access token for authentication.", "budgetId": "Required. String. The ID of the budget to retrieve transactions for.", "startDate": "Optional. String. The start date for transactions to be retrieved.", "endDate": "Optional. String. The end date for transactions to be retrieved."}
Output: A list of transactions with their ID, date, amount, payee, category, account, and memo.

6. Name: createTransaction
Description: Create a new transaction for a specific budget and account.
Input: {"accessToken": "Required. String. The user's access token for authentication.", "budgetId": "Required. String. The ID of the budget to create the transaction for.", "accountId": "Required. String. The ID of the account to create the transaction for.", "date": "Required. String. The date of the transaction.", "amount": "Required. Integer. The amount of the transaction.", "payeeId": "Optional. String. The ID of the payee for the transaction.", "categoryId": "Optional. String. The ID of the category for the transaction.", "memo": "Optional. String. A memo for the transaction."}
Output: The created transaction with its ID, date, amount, payee, category, account, and memo.

7. Name: updateTransaction
Description: Update an existing transaction for a specific budget and account.
Input: {"accessToken": "Required. String. The user's access token for authentication.", "budgetId": "Required. String. The ID of the budget to update the transaction for.", "transactionId": "Required. String. The ID of the transaction to update.", "date": "Optional. String. The new date of the transaction.", "amount": "Optional. Integer. The new amount of the transaction.", "payeeId": "Optional. String. The new ID of the payee for the transaction.", "categoryId": "Optional. String. The new ID of the category for the transaction.", "memo": "Optional. String. A new memo for the transaction."}
Output: The updated transaction with its ID, date, amount, payee, category, account, and memo.

8. Name: searchPayees
Description: Search for payees by name in a specific budget.
Input: {"accessToken": "Required. String. The user's access token for authentication.", "budgetId": "Required. String. The ID of the budget to search payees in.", "query": "Required. String. The search query for payee names."}
Output: A list of matching payees with their ID, name, and associated transactions.

9. Name: searchCategories
Description: Search for categories by name in a specific budget.
Input: {"accessToken": "Required. String. The user's access token for authentication.", "budgetId": "Required. String. The ID of the budget to search categories in.", "query": "Required. String. The search query for category names."}
Output: A list of matching categories with their ID, name, group, and budgeted amount.

Name: Steam
Description: Steam Web API documentation
Introduction: The Steam Web API is a comprehensive set of tools that allows developers to create exciting and engaging gaming experiences. It provides access to a wide range of data, including player profiles, game stats, achievements, and more. The Steam Web API includes the following functions: 1) Authentication - Secure user logins and authorizations. 2) Game stats - Retrieve player stats and other game data. 3) Inventory management - Access player inventories, including hats, weapons, and other items. 4) Achievements - Retrieve player achievements and unlockables. 5) Leaderboards - Access leaderboard data for specific games. The Steam Web API is an invaluable resource for game developers and enthusiasts alike, with endless possibilities for creating engaging and exciting gaming experiences.
